displaytitle: Antisemitic demonstration by members of Poland's right-wing nationalist party giving the Nazi salute, Jewish district of Warsaw

titles.title: Antisemitic demonstration by members of Poland's right-wing nationalist party giving the Nazi salute, Jewish district of Warsaw

makers.displaydate: 1897–1990; born St. Petersburg, Russia; died New York, NY; active Berlin, Germany, and New York City, NY
makers.displaymaker: Roman Vishniac, 1897–1990; born St. Petersburg, Russia; died New York, NY; active Berlin, Germany, and New York City, NY

texts.textentryhtml: The artist; estate of the artist; given to the Princeton University Art Museum, 2017.
texts.remarks: Mara Vishniac Cohn (previously Mara Schiff Cohn) managed her father's estate after he died in 1990.

texts.textentryhtml: In this photograph, Vishniac turns his attention from the experiences of European Jews to the rising anti-Semitic Nazi regime. He introduces a distance between himself and his subjects by taking this photograph from a window or balcony. The men, women, and children in the streets become a mass of light and dark that recedes down the avenue. In the title, Vishniac identifies the gestures of the crowd as the Nazi salute. His effort to picture the hateful intentions of this group runs up against the mundane appearance of the street demonstration, requiring the viewer’s close attention to the caption and details. This conflict between the ideology that the group represents and the banality of the scene raises important questions about our ability to recognize evil in the everyday.

displaymaker: Roman Vishniac, 1897–1990; born St. Petersburg, Russia; died New York, NY; active Berlin, Germany, and New York City, NY
caption: Roman Vishniac (1897–1990; born St. Petersburg, Russia; died New York, NY; active Berlin, Germany, and New York City, NY), Antisemitic demonstration by members of Poland's right-wing nationalist party giving the Nazi salute, Jewish district of Warsaw, ca. 1935–38, printed ca. 1945–55. Gelatin silver print; 27.9 × 26.7 cm (image), 35.4 × 27.9 cm (sheet). Gift of Mara Vishniac Kohn (2017-251)
